name: Raiders of the Broken Planet - Council Apocalypse Campaign
detailed_description:
For Valeria Robespierre, daddy’s fortune bought her an important position on the Fifth Council’s expedition to the Broken Planet. Valeria is one in a million: smart, spunky and a cruel-ass bitch with no trace of humanity in her cold, bionic heart: her father’s pride. Valeria is completely familiar with the Council’s plans, so the Raiders are after her. Catching her alive will be hard enough, but getting her to cooperate will be a real sight to see.
COUNCIL APOCALYPSE is one of the Raiders of the Broken Planet campaigns; an intense adventure made up of 4 challenging missions that you can play 4 vs 1 or on your own.

If this is your first campaign on the Broken Planet, in addition to the 4 missions, you will receive the substantial Adventure Prologue for free: 4 more missions in which you will try to rescue the savage Lycus Dion from the claws of the Hades Division.
  • Play COUNCIL APOCALYPSE with Raiders Harec, Konstantin, Alicia and Lycus.
  • Recruit the unpredictable Valeria on your race against the Fifth Council to be the first to find the Protectors.
  • You can also hire other Raiders, such as Hans, Mikah, Ginebra...
  • Play with all of them, choose your favorites and adapt them to your playing style with the character and faction cards that you earn by playing missions...

  • ... OR DO THE EXACT OPPOSITE: Infiltrate the games of other Raiders as an ANTAGONIST, ruin their missions together with the invading hordes and prevent them from defeating the Fifth Council. Being the bad guy has never looked so good!

Masterfully combining the missions guided by the narrative with the raging 4 vs 1 competitiveness, RAIDERS OF THE BROKEN PLANET is a fresh, surprising, one-of-a-kind experience.

short_description: The Fifth Council has been collecting archaeological data since they arrived on the Broken Planet. They’re up to something and Harec fears they may be searching for the Protectors. If that’s true, the Raiders need to stay ahead of them. They need the help of one of them. But how do you get an incorruptible enemy to cooperate?
